newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary maize futures drop, milling wheat firms.
newsitem.headline: Hungary maize futures drop, milling wheat firms.

text.p: Maize futures prices fell on the Budapest Commodity Exchange on better weather and falling wold market prices, while milling wheat futures rose due to a technical price correction, dealers said.
Grains turnover on the BCE totalled a meagre 108.3 million forints or 217 lots, down from Thursday's 251.2 million forints.
Maize futures fell for all maturities traded on Friday. The most active, December dropped 380 forints to 20,420.
"Global outlooks for feed grains are good," said Termin Broker's Robert Vajo. "Also the weather was good for maize...there is rain and sunshine."
Milling wheat futures, which fell recently on good weather and lower world market prices, firmed on Friday in all traded maturities.
August milling wheat rose 140 to 23,990 forints, while October firmed 380 forints to 25,490.
"This may be due to a technical (upward) correction and to low turnover too," Vajo said.
The direction in which wheat and milling wheat future prices go in the next few weeks will be determined by global weather trends, dealers said.
